meanings.definition: To bloom more than something else.
meanings.sent1: The sunflower is outblooming the daisy in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The roses outblooming the tulips this spring.
meanings.sent3: The competition between the flowers is fierce, with each trying to outblooming the other.
meanings.sent4: Her talent for painting outblooming all others in the art class.
meanings.sent5: The cherry blossoms outblooming all other trees in the park are a sight to behold.

meanings.sent1: The vibrant colors of the peony outblooming the rest of the garden.
meanings.sent2: Her garden always outblooming her neighbor's.
meanings.sent3: The race between the flowers to outblooming each other was a sight to see.
meanings.sent4: The beauty of the sunset outblooming any other evening.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks display outblooming all others in the sky was truly spectacular.

meanings.definition: The act of blooming more than something else.
meanings.sent1: The outblooming of the cherry blossoms was a sight to remember.
meanings.sent2: The outblooming of the roses in the garden was a delight.
meanings.sent3: The outblooming of the flowers in the competition was a close race.
meanings.sent4: The outblooming of her talent in art was evident to all.
meanings.sent5: The outblooming of the trees in the forest painted a beautiful landscape.
